title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SEATTLE (AP) — On a night where the final score felt secondary to a singular, breathtaking performance, Michael Finley authored a masterpiece. The Dallas Mavericks rode the historic, Herculean effort of their young star to an 89-81 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics, but this was far more than a simple road win. This was the night Finley exploded for 42 points, a scoring barrage that carved through a defenseless Seattle squad.

From the opening tip, Finley was in a different gear, attacking the rim with a ferocious intent that the Sonics had no answer for. He was the Mavericks' offense, a one-man whirlwind of mid-range jumpers and relentless drives. While his teammates struggled to find their rhythm, Finley provided a constant, brilliant flame, single-handedly keeping Dallas afloat and then pushing them ahead.

Seattle, led by the steadying presence of Detlef Schrempf’s 19 points and 11 rebounds, fought to contain the damage. But every time the Sonics threatened to close the gap, Finley had a response. A dagger three, a tough fadeaway, a fearless drive into the heart of the defense—his 42 points were not just a number, but a series of decisive blows that systematically broke Seattle's will.

The game will be logged as a win in the standings, but for those who witnessed it, it will be remembered as the Michael Finley Game. On this night, he wasn't just the best player on the floor; he was an unstoppable force, delivering a 42-point tour de force that secures his place in the Mavericks' record books and in the memories of all who saw it. Dallas won the battle, but Finley owned the night.
